result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(Cases 21CF1070, 22CT93, 22CF170, 22CF171, 22CF561, 22CF776, 22CT247 are called at 11:02 AM) Defendant James Haile appears in person with Attorney Robert Thorson. ADA Afton Lewis appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants in 21CF1070, 22CT93, 22CF170, 22CF171, 22CF561, 22CF776 are executed. Defense waives reading complaints in 22CF776, 22CT247. State requests $250 cash bond to cover 22CF776, 22CT247. Defense requests $50 cash bond. Court orders $5,000 signature bond to cover 22CF776, 22CT247 with various conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived in 22CF776. Court orders the bonds previously ordered in 21CF1070, 22CT93, 22CF170, 22CF171, 22CF561 remain in effect. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 21CF1070, 22CF170, 22CF171, 22CF561, 22CF776. 
Arraignment in 21CF1070, 22CF170, 22CF171, 22CF561, 22CF776 (22CT93, 22CT247 to ride along) to be scheduled with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.
Return on warrant on July 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

(Cases called at 2:30 PM - 21CF1070, 22CF170, 22CF171, 22CF561, 22CT93, and 22CF776)
No appearance by Defendant James Haile.  Attorney Robert Thorson appears.  Attorney Monica Fallon appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Thorson tried to call the Defendant but his phone is not receiving calls at this time.  State requests a warrant - so ordered.
Preliminary hearing on July 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:18 AM cases 21CF1070, 22CF170, 22CT93, 22CF561, 22CF171 called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James R. Haile in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James R. Haile. Defense requests preliminary hearings. 
A preliminary hearing is schedule in all felony files for 7/12/22 at 2:30 PM with misdemeanors riding along.
